answers.answer: A warm bath helped me, or a warm compress but eventually nothing helped and that's when u know u need to go to the hospital! Good luck ")
Why does she wanna get things going so early? -Just curious. Btw, if you or the baby isn't ready yet it will most likely hurt more.

She wants to get things going so early because I can't go passed 39 weeks due to gestational diabetes. He would gain too much weight if I went full term. She's guessing it would probably take about a week for me to be able to deliver, but he is so low right now that I really don't think it will take that long.

They told me a rocking chair,squats and music.my advice nurse also mentioned how u can bring earphones to the delivery room and just try to get everything to go fast by rocking urself with music during the contractions,squats or even walking etc cause I guess the point is for the baby to be in place by the time your dilated enough to push out the baby.im a first mommy to be aswell and I'm 38 weeks now shes not out yet lol but this is just stuff that overtime the nurses or other moms,family members have told me to have in mind so just sharing it with u so maybe it can kinda give u an idea.i wish u a safe,healthy,fast delivery :)
Yoga ball circular motions sitting on it

question: I had my doctors appointment this last week, and my doctor said she is going to scratch my cervix to get things going when I am 37w3d. I am a first time mom and I have a very low pain tolerance. Can anyone give any tips on how to deal with contractions at home before going to the hospital? My doctor said they will send me home if my contractions are too far apart.
title: Labor
